questions.question: A collection of interconnected devices (such as computers, printers, and servers) that can communicate and share resources with each other.
A set of rules and conventions that govern how data is transmitted and received over a network. It defines how devices should communicate with each other.
A unique numerical label assigned to each device on a network. It is used to identify and locate devices on the internet or a local network.
A network that covers a small geographical area, such as a home, office, or campus.
A network that spans a larger geographical area, often connecting multiple LANs.
A device or software that connects two different networks, allowing them to communicate with each other. It acts as a bridge between networks with different protocols.
Refers to the capacity or speed at which data can be transmitted over a network. It is typically measured in bits per second (bps) or megabits per second (Mbps).
A small unit of data that is transmitted over a network. Data is divided into packets for efficient transmission and reassembled at its destination.
A nlogical subdivision of an IP network. It helps manage and organize IP addresses within a network.
A data structure on a router that contains information about the routes to reach different network destinations.
It is the IP address of the router or gateway that connects a local network to other networks, such as the internet.
